profileText: A Representative from Massachusetts; born in Barnstable, Mass., June 14, 1746; was graduated from Harvard College in 1764; studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Boston; member of the State house of representatives 1782-1785 and 1788-1790; member of the convention in 1788 which ratified the Constitution; elected as a Pro-Administration candidate to the Second and Third Congresses (March 4, 1791-March 3, 1795); served as justice of the court of common pleas of Suffolk County from 1799 until his death in Boston, Mass., March 11, 1806.

researchRecord.name: In the Robert Treat Paine Papers, 1659-1862; 13 boxes, 45 slip-cases, 2 volumes, 1 folder, and 3 oversize containers.
researchRecord.description: Correspondents include Shearjashub Bourne. A published guide is available in the repository.
